translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekavihāri
The Elder Ucchukhaṇḍika’s Birth Story
“In the city of Bandhumatī,
I was a gatekeeper.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
who had gone beyond all things.

analyzed: ucchukhaṇḍikam ādāya  buddha seṭṭhaḥ sadā saha
translated: Taking a piece of sugar,🔽I always gave it to the best Buddha,
with a confident mind and a happy mind,
to the great seer Vipassī.
For ninety-one eons,
the sugar I gave then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the piece of sugar.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ucchukhaṇḍiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai ucchukhaṇḍikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Ucchukhaṇḍika recited these verses.
The Elder Ucchukhaṇḍika’s Birth Story is the fifth.
